name: v0.11.3
body: 💎 Adds support for MinGW UCRT. [RubyInstaller 3.1 introduced](https://rubyinstaller.org/2021/12/31/rubyinstaller-3.1.0-1-released.html) a new C-runtime called UCRT, which replaces MSVCRT to bring better compatibility to C standards and libraries compiled with Microsoft Visual Studio. This Ruby 2D version is now compatible with both [MSYS2 environments](https://www.msys2.org/docs/environments/#msvcrt-vs-ucrt), MINGW64 (RubyInstaller 3.0.3 and earlier) and UCRT (RubyInstaller 3.1.0 and later).

name: v0.11.2
body:
- 🔤 Limits the amount of fonts that are cached (#225) — by @mariovisic
- 💨 Improves tileset rendering performance by another ~50% (#231) — by @mariovisic
- 🪆 Adds support for nested sprite blocks to sequence animations (#233) — by @nogginly
- ⚙️ Restores native build pipeline, prep work for WebAssembly (#121)

name: v0.11.1
body: 🐛 Small fix for Apple Silicon / M1 Macs (arm64). Resolves the `Symbol not found '_ModPlug_GetSettings'` error.

name: v0.11.0
body:
- ⚡️ Improves texture rendering by 75% 😲 (#213) — Nice work @mariovisic!
- 🔊 Volume control added to `Sound` (#170) — Thanks @tlrasor!
- 🔤 Adds font styles, like bold and italics (#214) — _Impressive_ @mariovisic!
- 🎨 Moves `.r`/`.g`/`.b`/`.a` shortcuts to `.color` (#206) — Thanks @collindonnell!
- 🌀 Adds flipping and rotation to tilesets (#211) — Thanks @mariovisic!
- 💻 Improvements for BSD — Thanks @wmoxam and @compufox!
- 🛠 Lots of refactoring and fixes, thanks (again) to @mariovisic!

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.10.0...v0.11.0)

name: v0.10.0
body:
- 🔷 Adds support for tilesets (#201 by @mariovisic) — [see usage](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/pull/201/files#diff-af93da6ef4f7ed41c80e4154692d84a7ff2fc0f84a06d32fce06e4e85cd28d9d)

- 🎵 Check the `.length` of audio files (#198 by @mariovisic)

name: v0.9.5
body:
- 🔡 Adds support for UTF-8 text rendering
- ⚙️ Incorporates [Simple 2D](https://github.com/simple2d/simple2d) into the native extension, so it's no longer a dependency

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.9.4...v0.9.5)

name: v0.9.4
body:
- ⚡️ Huge performance improvements using OpenGL 3.3+, by way of batch rendering
- 🖼 Fixes an issue with SDL 2.0.10 and macOS 10.15 (Catalina) where the viewport doesn't fill the entire window (for real this time)

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.9.3...v0.9.4)

name: v0.9.3
body: Fixes macOS Catalina issue where OpenGL viewport does not fill the window.

name: v0.9.2
body: Fixes an installation issue on macOS with a case-sensitive file system, see #154. 🍎 Thanks @cdlm!

name: v0.9.1
body: This release simplifies installing the gem on Linux. Just install a few required packages first, then the gem, and you're all set! 🐧 See [ruby2d.com](http://www.ruby2d.com) for details.

name: v0.9.0
body:
This release introduces an even simpler way to install Ruby 2D on macOS and Windows. Just `gem install ruby2d` — no dependencies or special command prompt setup. Everything is now packaged with the gem! 📦

[See all changes here.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.8.1...v0.9.0)

name: v0.8.1
body:
🐛 Just bug fixes. [See all of them here.](
https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.8.0...v0.8.1)

name: v0.8.0
body:
- 🔄 Adds an interactive console, so now you can interact with graphics in real time. Just run `ruby2d console your_app.rb`
- 📷 Adds the ability to take screenshots in PNG with `get :screenshot` or `Window.screenshot`. You can also pass a file path if you'd like.
- 👾 Color can now be set for sprites.
- 🔳 Opacity can now be set when instanciating a renderable object, like `Square.new(opacity: 0.5)`
- 🌈 Color objects can now be created from existing colors, for example `Square.new(color: thing.color)`. Thanks @mariovisic — #141
- 🖥 Adds ability to create macOS app bundles, using `ruby2d build --macos your_app.rb`
- 🎨 Adds an asset path variable, `Ruby2D.assets`. By default this resolves to `./assets`, and when run in a macOS app bundle, will be `App.app/Contents/Resources/assets`, for example.
- 🔲 Fix for the `contains?` method on renderable objects, so points over the edges of shapes evaluates to `true` — #137

[See all changes.](
https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.7.0...v0.8.0)

name: v0.7.0
body:
⚠️ This release includes some breaking API changes to the `Image`, `Sprite`, and `Text` classes. Please check [ruby2d.com/learn](http://www.ruby2d.com/learn/) for the latest usage.

* Reorganize `Image`, `Sprite`, and `Text` class instantiation to use positional arguments for required values, and keyword arguments for all others. Thanks for the idea @andrewhavens! — #127
* Implements volume control for `Music` 🔊 Thanks @heitorado! — #123
* `Sprite#play` now takes a hash, instead of positional arguments
* Fixes some Font crashes 💥

[See all changes.](
https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.6.1...v0.7.0)

name: v0.6.1
body:
Small update to address a few issues:
- Raspbian (Raspberry Pi) was missing a build flag
- Building for web is temporarily disabled while we transition to WebAssembly — WIP PR #121 
- Text will now try to use a default system font, thanks to the new `Font` class 🔡 Thanks @lstrzebinczyk! — #53 

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.6.0...v0.6.1)

name: v0.6.0
body:
Major changes include:
- A new `Circle` class 🔴
- A redesigned `Sprite` class 👾 #33
- Texture rotation for images, sprites, and text 🌀
- Ability to set the window icon 🖼
- Window attributes can now be accessed directly via class methods 🎛 Thanks for the idea @andrewhavens! — #86
- The frame rate can now be capped ⏱ Thanks @eiko — #106
- Color of renderable objects can now be set and read through a variety of convenience methods, like `.color.r/g/b/a` or simply `.r/g/b/a`. Also the British English spelling "colour" is now aliased 🇬🇧

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.5.1...v0.6.0)

name: v0.5.1
body:
- Loads controller mappings from file (`~/.ruby2d/controllers.txt` by default), if exists 🎮 Thanks @andrewhavens!
- Fixes for the latest MSYS2-based [RubyInstaller](https://rubyinstaller.org)
- Adds Windows CI [AppVeyor](https://www.appveyor.com)
- Updates for Travis CI, Opal, and Simple 2D

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.5.0...v0.5.1)

name: v0.5.0
body:
- Adds iOS and tvOS support! (#74) 📱📺
- Controllers axes and buttons are now mapped to names; also a new controller test to see it all in action (#79) 🎮
- Color values can now be beyond the `0.0..1.0` range, which produces some interesting results 🌈
- Dependency updates and other fixes 🐛

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.4.2...v0.5.0)

name: v0.4.2
body: Updates Ruby 2D for [Simple 2D v0.7.0](https://github.com/simple2d/simple2d/releases/tag/v0.7.0).

name: v0.4.1
body:
- Fixes image z-index on initialization (#67)
- Image width and height are now properly set in the constructor (#68)

name: v0.4.0
body:
- Adds ability to set color opacity to visual objects (#26 and #50)
- Adds attribute readers to `Text` width and height (#37)
- Introduces the `Ruby2D::Renderable` class containing methods to be shared across all visual objects (#38)
- Adds mouse button events (#43)
- Introduces a new, more intuitive interface for input events in the form `on :<event_type> do |event|`
- Image width and height are now properly stored when initialized (#51)
- Introduces a Z-index to all visual objects (#49)
- Events can now be removed from the window (#46)
- Introduces a new `Line` class (#54)
- Adds `#contains?` method to all visual objects (#61)
- All classes now use named parameters (keyword arguments) instead of positional arguments (#65)
- Lots of other fixes and internal improvements

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.3.1...v0.4.0)

A big thanks to @KillaPL, who was responsible for nearly all of the features in this release 🎉

body:
This is a major new beta release. The documented domain-specific language (DSL), all classes and build modes (interpreted, native, web) have been fully implemented — see the [Ruby 2D website](http://www.ruby2d.com) for details.

[See all changes.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.2.1...v0.3.0)

[See all changes here.](https://github.com/ruby2d/ruby2d/compare/v0.2.0...v0.2.1)
